meanings.definition: The quality or state of being what or of existing as a particular thing.
meanings.sent1: The whatness of the flower is its beautiful color.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't understand the whatness of the mysterious object.
meanings.sent3: The detective pondered the whatness of the missing clue.
meanings.sent4: The whatness of the situation was like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The whatness of the mountain peak took my breath away.

meanings.definition: The essential nature or character of something.
meanings.sent1: The whatness of the book lies in its captivating story.
meanings.sent2: She tried to capture the whatness of the character in her painting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the whatness of a clumsy clown.
meanings.sent4: The whatness of the forest was like a magical realm.
meanings.sent5: The whatness of the melody touched my soul.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being true or real.
meanings.sent1: The whatness of his words convinced me of his honesty.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the whatness of the ghost story.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick played with the whatness of reality.
meanings.sent4: The whatness of the dream felt more vivid than waking life.
meanings.sent5: The whatness of the painting made it seem alive.
